SEARCH
Package gov.cdc.izgateway.xform.endpoints.fhir

Class FhirController

java.lang.Object
gov.cdc.izgateway.xform.endpoints.fhir.FhirController
@RestController @RolesAllowed({"xform-sender","admin"}) @RequestMapping("/fhir") @Lazy(false) public class FhirController extends Object
The FHIR Controller implements methods enabling users to query an IIS via FHIR instead of V2 Messaging. The base capability of this component is to convert a FHIR query into a Z34 or Z44 query depending on the resource requested. This is the special sauce of the V2 to FHIR Converter for Immunization Registries Each Patient known to an IIS has a "chart", that is reflected by their immunization history. The operating assumption is that the Patient/id of the FHIR resource can be converted back to the parameters necessary to query the IIS when necessary to collect the patient chart. Given a patient id, the chart can be reconstructed, and requested resources can be read back from the chart. So long as the IIS retains the data, the resource should be able to be "found" again. The resources supported are listed below. Values between () indicate source of the resource data. Values between [] indicate how it is uniquely identified in the chart. - Patient (PID+PD1) [name,gender,dob,first identifier] - Immunization (ORC/RXA/RXR+OBX) [ServiceRequest.identifer from ORC-3] - ImmunizationRecommendation* (ORC/RXA/RXR+OBX) [ServiceRequest.identifer from ORC-3] - ServiceRequest (ORC) [ORC-3] - Organization (MSH, ORC-23, PD1-4) [name, identifier] - Endpoint (MSH) [name] - Practitioner (EVN-5, OBX-15,16,25, ORC-12,21, PD1-4, PV1-7,8,9,17,52, RXA-10) [name, identifier] - PractitionerRole (OBX-15,16,25, ORC-12,21,23) [org unique value + practitioner unique value] - Location (EVN-7, ORC-29, PV1-3,6,11,37,40,42,43, RXA-11,27,28) [name computed from location] - RelatedPerson (NK1) [name] - Encounter (PV1) [first identifier] - Account (PID-18) [identifier] * ImmunizationRecommendation resources are notable "transient" in nature and change over time, and so may not be retrievable at a future point in time.
Author:
Audacious Inquiry

    • FhirController

      public FhirController(@Autowired HubController hub, FhirController.FhirConfiguration config, gov.cdc.izgateway.security.AccessControlRegistry registry)
      Construct the FhirController. It calls HubController methods directly so needs to know where the hub is.
      Parameters:
      hub - The hub controller to talk to.
      config - The configuration for the converter
      registry - The Access Control Registry

  • Method Details

    • iisQuery

      @RequestMapping(value={"/{destinationId}/Immunization","/{destinationId}/ImmunizationRecommendation","/{destinationId}/Patient"}, method={GET,POST,HEAD}, produces={"application/fhir+xml","application/fhir+json","application/fhir+yaml","application/xml","application/json","application/yaml","text/xml"}) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Bundle> iisQuery(@PathVariable String destinationId, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req) throws gov.cdc.izgateway.xform.endpoints.fhir.FaultException, ca.uhn.hl7v2.HL7Exception, gov.cdc.izgateway.xform.endpoints.fhir.UnexpectedException, gov.cdc.izgateway.soap.fault.SecurityFault
      Send a Z34 Request Immunization History or Z44 Request Evaluated History and Recommendation request to an IIS and return the requested resources.
      Parameters:
      destinationId - The destination for the FHIR Request. This takes the place of the destinationId element shown below in Soap Messages. 
            
     dev
      req - The HttpServletRequest to get the request parameters from.
      Returns:
      A FHIR Bundle containing the search results, or an OperationOutcome resource if there was an exception, fault or error processing the message.
      Throws:
      gov.cdc.izgateway.xform.endpoints.fhir.FaultException - When a SoapFault is reported.
      ca.uhn.hl7v2.HL7Exception - When a message cannot be parsed.
      gov.cdc.izgateway.xform.endpoints.fhir.UnexpectedException - When something goes wrong that shouldn't have
      gov.cdc.izgateway.soap.fault.SecurityFault - When a security fault occurs

    • iisRead

      @RequestMapping(value={"/{destinationId}/Immunization/{id}","/{destinationId}/ImmunizationRecommendation/{id}","/{destinationId}/Patient/{id}"}, method={GET,HEAD}, produces={"application/fhir+xml","application/fhir+json","application/fhir+yaml","application/xml","application/json","application/yaml","text/xml"}) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Resource> iisRead(@PathVariable String destinationId, @PathVariable String id, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req) throws gov.cdc.izgateway.xform.endpoints.fhir.FaultException, ca.uhn.hl7v2.HL7Exception, gov.cdc.izgateway.xform.endpoints.fhir.UnexpectedException, gov.cdc.izgateway.soap.fault.SecurityFault
      Read an Immunization, ImmunizationRecommendation or Patient resource. This just does a query by _id on patient, and then selects the appropriate result.
      Parameters:
      destinationId - The identifier of the destination IIS
      id - The identifier of the immunization resource.
      req - The HttpServletRequest so we can process parameters.
      Returns:
      The requested Resource
      Throws:
      gov.cdc.izgateway.xform.endpoints.fhir.FaultException - When a fault occurs.
      ca.uhn.hl7v2.HL7Exception - When an HL7 Message exception occurs
      gov.cdc.izgateway.xform.endpoints.fhir.UnexpectedException - When some other exception occurs
      gov.cdc.izgateway.soap.fault.SecurityFault - When a security fault occurs

    • iisPatientMatch

      @RequestMapping(value="/{destinationId}/Patient/$match", method={POST,HEAD}, produces={"application/yaml","application/json","application/xml","application/fhir+xml","application/fhir+json","application/fhir+yaml","text/xml"}) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Resource> iisPatientMatch(@PathVariable String destinationId, @RequestBody org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Resource body, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req) throws gov.cdc.izgateway.xform.endpoints.fhir.FaultException, ca.uhn.hl7v2.HL7Exception, gov.cdc.izgateway.xform.endpoints.fhir.UnexpectedException, gov.cdc.izgateway.soap.fault.SecurityFault
      Perform the patient match operation. This performs a query on patient, and then selects the appropriate result.
      Parameters:
      destinationId - The identifier of the destination IIS
      body - The operation parameters, as a Parameters resource, or a Patient resource
      req - The HttpServletRequest so we can process parameters.
      Returns:
      A bundle of Patient Resources
      Throws:
      gov.cdc.izgateway.xform.endpoints.fhir.FaultException - When a fault occurs.
      ca.uhn.hl7v2.HL7Exception - When an HL7 Message exception occurs
      gov.cdc.izgateway.xform.endpoints.fhir.UnexpectedException - When some other exception occurs
      gov.cdc.izgateway.soap.fault.SecurityFault - When a security fault occurs
